Title: OpenAFS: Privilege escalation
Synopsis:
OpenAFS is subject to a design flaw that could allow privilege escalation
    on the client.

Background.Text: OpenAFS is a distributed network filesystem.

Description.Text: Benjamin Bennett discovered that the OpenAFS client contains a design flaw where cache managers do not use authenticated server connections when performing actions not requested by a user.

Impact.Text: If setuid is enabled on the client cells, an attacker can supply a fake FetchStatus reply that sets setuid and root ownership of a file being executed. This could provide root access on the client. Remote attacks may be possible if an attacker can entice a user to execute a known file. Note that setuid is enabled by default in versions of OpenAFS prior to 1.4.4.

Workaround.Text: Disable the setuid functionality on all client cells. This is now the default configuration in OpenAFS.

P.Text: All OpenAFS users should upgrade to the latest version:
